窰字的基本解释

窰
yáo
同“窑”。

窰字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yáo］
［《廣韻》餘昭切，平宵，以。］
亦作“窯1”。亦作“窑1”。
(1)烧制砖瓦陶瓷器或煅石灰的灶。
(2)指制造砖瓦陶瓷等物的场所。
(3)指陶瓷器。
(4)窑洞，供人居住的土室。
(5)近代泛指硅酸盐工业常用的高温设备。
(6)釆煤开挖的洞。
(7)方言。指妓院。参见“窰姐”。

窰字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　窰； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页867第12
【集韻】與窯同。　又【廣東新語】歸善有窰輋，其人耕無犁鋤，率以刀治土。種五穀，曰刀耕。燔林木，使灰入土，土煖而蛇蟲死，以爲肥，曰火耨。

Basic explanation of words
kiln
yáo

kiln
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yáo］
["Guangyun" Yu Zhaoqie, Ping Xiao, to. ]
Also known as "kiln 1". Also known as "kiln 1".
(1) A stove for burning bricks, ceramics or calcined lime.
(2) Refers to places where bricks, tiles, ceramics, etc. are manufactured.
(3) Refers to ceramics.
(4) Cave dwellings, earthen chambers for people to live in.
(5) In modern times, it generally refers to high-temperature equipment commonly used in the silicate industry.
(6) A hole excavated with coal.
(7) Dialects. Refers to the brothel. See "Sister Kiln".
kiln
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Collection] [Acupoint Word Department] 　 Kiln; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 867 No. 12
【Jiyun】Same as the kiln.　[Guangdong New Language] Guishan has a kiln, who ploughs without a plow and hoe, and uses a knife to control the soil. Planting grains is called slash farming. Burnt trees, make ashes into the soil, the soil is warm and the snakes and insects die, thinking that it is fat, it is called fire.
